Recent Searches Gong Cheng ☰ Info 1 Version : 123 Date Modified : 21-Nov-2025 20:43 Author : 程龚 More Info... Attachments1 Reading time: 2 mins, 453 words Edit More... View Page Source Show Reader View Email: gcheng (AT) nju.edu.cn Office: Room 309, Building of Computer Science Technology, Nanjing University Xianlin Campus, 163 Xianlin Avenue, Nanjing 210023, China Phone: +86-25-89680923 Homepage: http://ws.nju.edu.cn/~gcheng Twitter: Gong Cheng 中文 Gong Cheng is a professor at the School of Computer Science, Nanjing University. His research interests include big data retrieval, knowledge graph, and LLM inference with applications to search engines, decision support systems, question answering systems, etc. His research has been published at academic conferences and in journals including WWW, SIGIR, and TKDE, and has received or been nominated for seven best paper awards from ISWC, ESWC, and COLING. He served as PC co-chairs of ISWC 2024 and CCKS 2023. At present, his research is focused on dataset retrieval: search engines for open datasets, featuring dataset fusion, retrieval, ranking, summarization, recommendation, etc.;[ EMNLP 2025 | SIGIR 2025 | SIGIR 2024 | SIGIR 2024 ] graph search algorithms: search algorithms for large graph data, e.g., efficient approximation algorithms for Group Steiner Tree problems;[ WWW 2024 | WWW 2023 | WWW 2023 ] LLM inference: optimization of LLM inference for specific tasks and solving complex problems in critical domains;[ NeurIPS 2024 | ICLR 2024 | AAAI 2023 ] knowledge-based RAG: retrieval of multi-source heterogeneous knowledge, e.g., knowledge graphs and tables, for enhancing the generation of LLMs.[ ISWC 2025 ] Publications# DBLP Google Scholar Awards# ISWC 2023 Best Research Paper Nominee ISWC 2021 Best Resource Paper Nominee ESWC 2020 Best Research Paper Award ESWC 2020 Best Resource Paper Nominee COLING 2018 Area Chair Favorites ISWC 2014 Best Research Paper Nominee ISWC 2011 Best Research Graph Data and Knowledge Guest editor of# Journal of Web Semantics (Special Issue on Knowledge Graphs and Information Retrieval) Distinguished reviewer of# ACM Transactions on the Web This page
